recipes.name: Southern Style Green Bean
instructions: In a medium pot on medium heat, melt butter and add bacon pieces.
Cook for a couple of minutes, then add onion, thyme, and parsley. Stir frequently for 10 minutes.
Add green beans and quartered potatoes. Cover with water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to a simmer, cover, and cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

recipes.name: Fettuccine Alfredo with Mushrooms
instructions: Cook the fettuccine in salted water according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter with olive oil. Add garlic and mushrooms and sauté for 5-7 minutes until mushrooms are soft.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Add grated parmesan cheese and stir until melted and smooth.
Season with salt and black pepper. Add the cooked pasta and toss until coated.
Serve immediately with additional parmesan if desired.

recipes.name: Raspberry Cheesecake Bars
instructions: Cream together the butter with sugars, lemon zest, egg, and vanilla.
Add salt and flour; chill dough, then press into tart pan and bake at 350°F for 20 mins.
Whip cream cheese, almond extract, and condensed milk. Fold in whipped cream.
For sauce: simmer raspberries, sugar, and water. Add cornstarch slurry and cook until thick.
Pour cream mixture over crust, chill for an hour, and serve topped with raspberry sauce.

recipes.name: Avocado Chicken Salad
instructions: Season chicken breast with salt and pepper, then boil until cooked. Cool and cube the meat.
Cut avocados into cubes.
Toss salad greens with olive oil and lime juice. Divide into bowls.
Top each bowl with avocado, chicken, and cherry tomatoes.
Drizzle with mayonnaise and a dash of black pepper. Serve.

recipes.name: Coconut Pecan Chicken Salad
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Prepare three bowls: one with flour, one with egg and milk mixture, and one with combined sugar, coconut, pecans, and breadcrumbs.
Coat chicken in flour, dip in egg mix, then coat with coconut mixture.
Fry in vegetable oil until golden and cooked through. Let cool, then slice.
Arrange salad greens, cheese, mandarin oranges, and strawberries on plates.
Top with sliced chicken and drizzle with poppy seed dressing.

recipes.name: Maple Dijon Apple Coleslaw
instructions: Shred green and red cabbage, and grate the carrot.
Thinly slice the apple and chop green onions and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, apple cider vinegar, Dijon mustard, and maple syrup.
Toss all salad ingredients in a large bowl.
Drizzle with dressing, season with salt and pepper, and toss again.
Let sit for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Authentic Kentucky Bourbon Balls
instructions: In a deep bowl, combine crushed vanilla wafer crumbs, chopped pecans, powdered sugar, and cocoa.
In a separate bowl, mix the bourbon and corn syrup.
Pour the bourbon mixture into the dry mixture and blend well.
Cover and chill for 3 hours.
Shape dough into small balls and roll in powdered sugar.
Store in refrigerator overnight in a tightly covered container.

recipes.name: Zucchini and Tomato Toss
instructions: Slice zucchini into rounds and halve the grape tomatoes.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add zucchini and cook for 5–7 minutes until tender.
Stir in tomatoes and cook for another 2–3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, then top with fresh basil and grated parmesan.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Sun-Dried Tomato and Feta Stuffed Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Butterfly the chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper.
Mix sun-dried tomatoes, feta, spinach, and garlic in a bowl.
Stuff each chicken breast with the mixture and secure with toothpicks.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet and sear each side of the chicken until golden.
Transfer skillet to oven and bake for 20 minutes or until cooked through.
Rest for 5 minutes before serving.
